attributes.comment:
I am opposed to the fee increases from the U.S. Citizenship and Immigration
Services docket number USCIS-2006-0044. These fee increases would create
added financial stress on families wanting to adopt. If a company increased their
prices and fees by 66% in a year then that company would be out of business.
My wife and I are adopting 4 children. Thankfully we only had to submit
paperwork to INS once, however we know couples that are 2 years into a 3 year
process and they will have to submit again before completing the adoption
process. These fee increases are ridiculous. For some couples the only option
for having kids is to adopt. Also with the difficulty and enormous red tape of
domestic adoption their only alternative is international adoption. There are
couples that want to have children and want to be able to provide a good, loving
home for those children. There are children that are in desperate need of love,
attention, and the opportunity to grow up in this type of environment. With the
proposed fee increases these two groups may never meet. It will build barriers
that will prevent these two from coming together and forming a home. Some
couples that are considering adoption will get to these fees and decide to turn
back and forgo the adoption process all together. I urge you to reconsider and
then shelve the proposed fee increases for the sake of the children needing good
homes, and for the families that can provide those good homes. You can make a
difference with your decision. Thank you for your time.

sincerely,

Shelby Luckel

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Shelby M. Luckey
